Title: CHART CORRECTION - I was contacted by Legal who is working on Guardianship/Conservator paperwork for this patient and his date of birth and last name are incorrect. Also, documentation in his chart r
Description:
Epic:
CHART CORRECTION - I was contacted by Legal who is working on Guardianship/Conservator paperwork for this patient and his date of birth and last name are incorrect. Also, documentation in his chart refers to him as a 60 year old male when he is actually over 70 years of age. Following is the email I received:

  "I'm working on a guardian/conservator petition for a patient at CRMH, and the record has an incorrect birth date, which the patient has acknowledged is incorrect.  The social worker contacted Patient Access to request a change of the birth date but was told that change cannot occur until the patient is discharged.  The problem is that, in multiple progress notes, the physicians are referring to the patient as a "60-year old male," when he is actually over 70 years old.  The patient's MRN is 998939, last name is Berrman; however, the medical record appears to still refer to him as Berriom.  Long story short, this patient has utilized multiple aliases, but his social worker Brittany has received confirmation of legal name and birth date from Social Security and the VA.  You likely want to reach out to Brittany to get additional information on this patient issue."   I have reached out to Legal and asked for Brittany's last name and phone number.

07/18/17 10:56:14 US/Eastern (DLCAMERON):
sent email to client...

Hello Sam,

Ok, what I found out about not being able to add Dr. Unwin as a PCP.
A committee of providers got together and decided what type of providers should be allowed to be a PCP for a patient. It was decided the specialty of Geriatrics should not be included. Therefore any provider with a specialty of Geriatrics cannot be a PCP for a patient.

Dr. Speaker, one of the providers in that group said they would re-review this if a case is made for a Geriatric provider to be marked as a PCP.

Do you want to reply with the reasons why we need Dr. Unwin to be the PCP and I will take it up with them and try and get this reversed?

Let me know.

Thanks.
07/18/17 10:55:33 US/Eastern (DLCAMERON):
David,
This provider has a specialty type of Geriatric Medicine.  With the 2015 upgrade we moved to using the provider’s specialty in an extension to determine who could be listed as a PCP.  Dr. Speaker approved the list of specialties for us, but Geriatric Medicine was not one of them, so that is why this provider can’t be chosen as a PCP.  I think we would need his approval to update the LPP which would allow this provider to be chosen.  Let us know if this helps.

Jess

Jessica C. Wall
Application Analyst
TSG - ADT/HIM Team
451 Kimball Ave., Ste. 218
Roanoke, VA 24016
Office: 540.224.4229
Cell: 540.339.6041
jcwall@carilionclinic.org

Our mission: Improve the health of the communities we serve.

Subject: question

I have an issue I can’t figure out, and I wonder if you might have some guidance. A nurse is trying to add Dr. Brian Unwin, specialty of Geriatrics,  as a PCP on a patient. She is unable too. She is able to add this provider to the Care Team, but not as a PCP.

The SER team reports the SER is ok
The Cadence team says the patient is not dismissed or anything like that.
The only thing I see in common is we cannot add other providers from the same specialty as a PCP either.
The nurse is able to add other providers as a PCP so I don’t think it is an access issue.

Thoughts?

Thanks.

Username: RMHURD

Update Action:
08/22/17 08:29:37 US/Eastern (EACLINGENPEEL):
Heard back from 2 of the Clinical Admins doing staffing about instances of the error even while using the direct link.

Updated the case with Kronos
08/17/17 10:07:32 US/Eastern (EACLINGENPEEL):
Connected Rose Hurd and Savorn Kong through a conference call to talk about the error. Savorn made the request to have Rose use Kronos through direct link instead of using the Citrix icon. She is able to do this by opening Firefox and typing kronos.carilion.com in the address bar. He would like for her to try this for a week to see if she still gets the error. She has agreed to do this.

I will also contact the Staffing Office and ask them to do the same thing. I have sent an email to Kathy Ott and attached a reminder notice to be hung up next to the staffing computer. The attachment I sent is on the attachment tab and the email is pasted below:

From: Clingenpeel, Elizabeth A. (Beth)
Sent: Thursday, August 17, 2017 10:03 AM
To: Ott, Donna K. (Kathy) <dkott@carilionclinic.org>
Cc: Rogers, Kevin S. <ksrogers@carilionclinic.org>
Subject: Kronos - 2 Items

Kathy,

I have 2 items for you – 1 is a request for the Staffing Office, the other is for your review:

1.	When Kevin and I were there last week to meet with Brandie & you, we were talking to Karen Reese while she was doing some staffing. She casually mentioned an error that she has been seeing pop up recently that we thought had disappeared. It happens to be the same error that Rose Hurd has reported. Until Karen said something, we thought just Rose was getting it because no one else had reported it. The error doesn’t keep the user from doing anything or information from saving, it’s mainly an annoyance, but still needs to be fixed. We are working with Kronos to solve. I was on the phone with Rose and a Kronos support person this morning and he would like to see if this error is related to the version of Citrix we are currently running. To test this we are asking Rose to not use the Kronos icon on the desktop, but instead open Firefox and type Kronos.carilion.com to get to Kronos. Will you also ask the Staffing Office to do this? Sending this ticket to Physician Training to have them walk Dr. Collier through addending his attestation to reflect the date of 7/3/17 omstead of 7/4/17 on the DoD related Progress note that was filed at 12:32 on 7/5/17.

Date of Service was the 7/3/17 Admission to RMH.
08/02/17 11:58:41 US/Eastern (WMQUESENBERRY):
Email communication from Dr. Collier and Tina Bradshaw.
"Dr. Collier said he was present on 7/3 - he can't get the note corrected on his Attestation of the resident notes.
Thanks

Per Dr.Collier:



Collier, Bryan R, DO  Bradshaw, Tina D, MOA



     You are right. I was present on July 3. All events happened prior to midnight. I am not sure how to change in the chart at this point."

I then sent the below email back to Tina and Julie.

"Hey Tina and Julie,

He won’t be able to change what the other provider wrote in his note..but Dr. Collier can addend his attestation on that note. I logged in as him in SUP and it’s fairly simple.

Based on his communication, I don’t need to change anything that was requested in Julie’s ticket, correct?

Ticket information:
“Issue reported by user:
Date of death needs to be changed from 7/3/17 to 7/4/17.

Per Dr Collier who was in room at time of death:
Incorrect Time of Death: 7/3/17 at 2349
Correct Time of Death: 7/4/17 at 0023”


I can send this ticket to a physician trainer who can reach out to Dr. Collier to help him addend his attestation if he wants to change his verbiage from 7/4 to 7/3, once I have confirmation from you all no action needs to be taken from a technology perspective.


Thanks."
08/02/17 11:14:43 US/Eastern (WMQUESENBERRY):
Received communication from Julie and billing folks below that Dr. Collier wants to "edit" the note because the DoD is actually 7/4/17. See my below email coorespondence with HIM and Billing.

"Hey team,

This one is a little tricky because Dr. Collier did not write the note. He co-signed another physician’s note (Dr. Rosenblat) with this Attestation “I was present with the resident on July 4 for the history, exam, and medical decision making when they were involved. I discussed the case and agree with the findings and plan as documented in the note and what is listed above.” In which Dr. Rosenblat stated the ToD was 23:49 on 7/3/17.

Also there are flowsheets that stop recording the patient’s vitals at 23:49 on 7/3/17 recorded by a different individual (Valerie Davis RN. These flowsheets indicate 0 pulse at 23:49 on 7/3/17.

Also there was a code blue initiated at 23:20 by Valerie Davis RN in which the code blue ended at 23:49 on 7/3/17 with a pulse of 0.

From a technology perspective we can help “correct” anything that needs to be corrected, but based on the information that is in EPIC by multiple folks I don’t feel very confident in making the changes / helping the provider with the changes being asked for.

From an operational perspective who can analyze this and make the decision of what the DoD should be? There are multiple pieces of clinical data currently supporting 7/3/17 23:49 but Dr. Collier is communicating with Billing operational folks that the date needs to be 7/4/17.

Patient MRN# 098557
Patient: Blankenship, Harold Douglas
DOS: 7/3/17


Thanks.

From: Jones, Julie D.
Sent: Tuesday, August 01, 2017 4:51 PM
To: Bradshaw, Tina D. <tdbradshaw@carilionclinic.org>; Vest, Judith S. (Judi) <jsvest@carilionclinic.org>; Hodges, Cynthia C. (CYNDI-CODING) <cchodges@carilionclinic.org>; Quesenberry, Whit M. <WMQuesenberry@carilionclinic.org>
Subject: RE: HD Ticket ***Time of Death Error** HD Tkt sd863312 submitted - see email update

Including Whit on email below.
________________________________________
From: Bradshaw, Tina D.
Sent: Tuesday, August 01, 2017 4:47 PM
To: Jones, Julie D.; Vest, Judith S. (Judi); Hodges, Cynthia C. (CYNDI-CODING)
Subject: RE: HD Ticket ***Time of Death Error** HD Tkt sd863312 submitted - see email update
Dr. Collier did get back to me and feels the DOS should be 7/3/17.    He can not addend his note to reflect 7/3 vs 7/4/17.   Can someone call him or get with him on how to addend his note ?
Thanks,

Tina Bradshaw, CPC, COSC, PCS
Coding Consultant Manager
Carilion Professional Billing, Coding and Consulting Services
Certificate of ICD-10-CM Proficiency
Revenue Cycle Management
Tdbradshaw@carilion.clinic.org
CASB -14th Flr
Suite 1409
540-224-5835"
08/01/17 09:59:06 US/Eastern (WMQUESENBERRY):
Kari Spradlin sent me the below email "Yes, this is one that the Analyst sent to have me review and change.

The resident documented a death pronouncement note filed on 7/4/17 1:47 pm (note started on 7/4 at 12:30 am), stating the time of death was called at 11:49 pm. This would be a late entry note due to death occurring so close to midnight. This note is co-signed by Dr. Collier. The death record in the flow sheets also states TOD as 2349 on 7/3/17. On the vital signs flow sheet the vitals ended at 2349 on 7/3 and show a pulse of 0. Also, no other events took place after that time.

I don't see any information in the documentation that we normally look at to determine date/time of death to support that Dr. Collier was in the room on 7/4 at 0023 and/or pronounced death at that time.

Based on the information I reviewed in the record, I feel that 7/3/17 @ 2349 is the correct discharge date/time of death for this record. "


In which I then emailed Julie Jones
"Hey Julie,

I received your helpdesk ticket and did a little research in EPIC. Upon doing research I noticed Kari Spradlin had abstracted the chart from an HIM perspective and changed the discharge and associated DoD with that information. She said that she found “The resident documented a death pronouncement note filed on 7/4/17 1:47 pm (note started on 7/4 at 12:30 am), stating the time of death was called at 11:49 pm 7/3/17. This would be a late entry note due to death occurring so close to midnight. This note is co-signed by Dr. Collier. The death record in the flow sheets also states TOD as 2349 on 7/3/17. On the vital signs flow sheet the vitals ended at 2349 on 7/3 and show a pulse of 0. Also, no other events took place after that time.”

HIM believes the appropriate DoD is 7/3/17 @ 23:49 due to their abstracting process. Did you find any documentation in EPIC from Dr. Collier that would support the DoD being changed to 7/4/17? The screenshots attached to the helpdesk ticket you submitted were of a workqueue and I did not see any clinical information in them with Dr. Collier saying the DoD was on 7/4/17.

I’d be glad to chat with you over the phone about this if you’d like.

540-293-0179"
07/31/17 20:29:07 US/Eastern (WMQUESENBERRY):
Spoke with Allison before receiving the ticket.
I then researched the patient in question.
With that information I sent the below email to Kari Spradlin (HIM Supervisor RMH) for help.
Hey Kari,

I received a helpdesk ticket from Julie at CASB in billing wanting to change the date of death time on a patient. I see in Event Management on the patient you had changed the discharge date on this patient from 7/4/17 early to 7/3/17 late. I imagine you were doing abstracting and noticed documentation that indicated to do so. Can you tell me what you were looking at when you made that change? In he helpJulie says Dr. Collier was in the room at the time of death and it was 7/4/17 0023, but a clinical RN was the person who initially made the DoD on 7/3/17.

Any thoughts on the appropriate date of death from your perspective?


Patient Name: Harold Blankenship
Patient MRN: 098557




Thank you!


I will follow up with her tomorrow when she is in the office.

08/25/17 08:13:59 US/Eastern (AJRAY):
While using Dragon Medical One, the users are unable to dictate into the Diagnosis field on the AMB side. This helps the providers save a lot of time typing out long dx codes for dx entry.

This workflow worked prior to the upgrade so it is likely not a Dragon issue but an Epic issue or some other system that changed with the upgrade.

Subject: Re: Forgot!

I'm looking at the the servers now and she has a profile on two out of the five servers.  They look a bit old.  I've deleted them in case that's the issue.  I don't see an issue with the servers and we've currently 42 sessions pretty much evenly distributed across all five servers.

Looked at her AD account and she should be fine for access to the application.  Here AD account is in all the groups needed.  Added it specifically to the app to be sure.

Since she's able to connect to other apps I don't think there's a overall SSL issue here.  If that was the case we'd have a lot more tickets from across multiple applications.

I logged onto the apps portal and was able to launch the Clintrac application to the logon screen successfully.

Ask her if she's entering her user name in caps.  I've seen an issue with a specific alpha combination in the past if it was entered in caps but this combination isn't in her user name.  Just a thought.  Recommend that she try it in lower case if she's not.

I'm out of the office today resting up for tonight's Epic2017 go live.  Hope this helps.

Research and reaction to Cactus technical support information.  Email copied below.  Summary - Carilion Cactus NPDB account holder must login to NPDB site and confirm user account information.
====================================
Hello Cheryl and Karen.

Cheryl - Thanks for recently helping me test the Cactus access to the NPDB site via NPDB QRXS query.  Here is the message generated by our test: To ensure account security, the account holder must sign in

According to Cactus support this following needs to occur:


-  The 'account creator' in Cactus for the NPDB has to login to the NPDB and verify that the correct people are in the NPDB account.  This is not Cactus related and is required as part of NPDB security.  (see attached for screenshots - Karen looks to be setup as NPDB account holder)

-  NPDB may ask to verify an IP address.  Cheryl and I saw this step, but we still received the message indicated above.

-  According to Cactus, after the account information is verified and the correct all should be successfully access the NPDB data.


Karen - As the current account holder, are you able to login to the NPDB site and verify the account and the people associated with the account?  Cactus support verified that in our case, the System Administrators are not part of the account setup in environment.



Thanks,



Kevin L. Roberts

Application Analyst | SER /Administrative Applications

Technology Services Group | Carilion Clinic

Office: 540.224.1496 | Cell: 540.397.7279



Our mission:  Improve the health of the communities we serve.

-  research

-  confirmed Cheryl can access the NPDB site directly with her account, but query Error Details indicate that 'account holder must sign in'

================================
Regarding NPDB access and response below.  We confirmed that the .NET Framework key value is 379893.  We also confirmed no host files and that the below web addresses can be reached on our Cactus Citirx server.

Additionally, I tested with a user that has an NPDB account and can successfully login to the NPDB site.  When she runs the NPDB query from within Cactus, the query fails with the Error Details description - 'To ensure account security, the account holder must sign in'.  Please see attached screen shot of the Error Details and Query Status.

Request further support assistance.  Query user can be available for further troubleshooting as needed.

------------------------------------
Hi Kevin,

As we just discussed on the phone about the credentialing issue you are having in 3.14.31, I can have a Support representative reach out on Wednesday when you are free to assist with the cred counts utility/cred fix utility.

Regarding the "Error opening connection to Data Bank server, check Internet" NPDB error, here is some more information that will help you and the rest of your IT team with ensuring all settings are good to go on your side with the NPDB using Visual CACTUS 3.14.31.

First, if any host files are used on local computers or servers, the new NPDB address will need to be mapped. The new address is http://www.npdb.hrsa.gov/ with an IP address of 54.186.167.170 on port 443. Unfortunately, the NPDB has lingering issues with migrating all its old addresses, or alternatively, forwarding old DNS addresses to its new location. For example, http://npdb-hipdb.hrsa.gov/ is no longer valid, but http://www.npdb-hipdb.hrsa.gov correctly forwards to http://www.npdb.hrsa.gov/. To connect, you will want to ensure host files, routing, and firewalls at all levels account for these changes.

Also, you will want to verify that the end users are running Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5.2 or higher on their workstations. The easiest way to verify this is to go to the registry on the workstation and verify the build. You will want to go to
Start > Run > regedit.exe, then navigate to
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\NET Framework Setup\NDP\v4\Full.

Title: Accounts are dropping from EPIC into our billing system SSI without the  Occurrence Code for onset of illness that is listed in Claim Info.  In the example HAR Claim Info Form has selected Illness 07
Description:
Accounts are dropping from EPIC into our billing system SSI without the  Occurrence Code for onset of illness that is listed in Claim Info.  In the example HAR Claim Info Form has selected Illness 07/14/17, but the data is not on the claim in SSI or in the Electronic Image of the data submitted to SSI.

Another example HAR is 105914166 that was on 08/10/17 download in SSI Claim Info has Illness 07/17/17 selected.

  I did notice that the claims hit a Claim Edit for An Accident Diagnosis code starting with S is listed but the claim info form and /or MSPQ does not indicate an accident and it was overridden by Janice Jones.  We are not hitting an edit in SSI because the Occ Code 11 is not being added to the claim by EPIC.

Hi Cyndi,
Angie and I reviewed this ticket and I am now working on it.  So we are in somewhat of a corner, i.e., occurrence code 11 didn't get automatically added because of the "S" code and then the PAS user overrode the claim edit so we end up with no S code.  Here are next steps:
1) The S code on this claim is S81.801S Unspecified open wound, right lower leg, sequela.  Is that one of the S codes that is excluded from needing an accident code?  After talking with Epic, if we can get the list of S codes that do not indicate accident we may be able to improve the automated logic for adding 11 by excluding these S codes.  In the past you have stated there are a lot of exceptions.  Is it possible to pull together this list and send it over?
2) As a short-term fix, I can add a claim edit when there is no occurrence code 01-06 or 11.  This would probably need to be worked by HB.  I don't think we want to go the route of PAS updating the claim directly, at least not right now.
3) What were you doing before PAS had the override?
thanks,
Barbara

[xMatters] - Notification delivered successfully to BABOATWRIGHT | iPhone
08/15/17 19:23:38 US/Eastern (AMRAMSAY):
Reviewed examples.  I unbilled and re-billed one of them in SUP to verify the Occ Code 11 was missing before any edits were made to the claim and it was.  I did get the claim edit that client mentions regarding the accident Dx.
Reviewed the CDF for Medicare and see the logic for Occ Code.  For OC 11 - Onset of Symptoms/Illness, there are two lines in the table using rules 740897 & 740898.
740897 - CC HB 11 Dx Not Accident
74098 - CC HB 11 Pt Recurring

The claims for these two examples do not meet either of these rules to automatically get OC 11.  Will need to f/u with co-worker to verify that this is the only logic that controls Occ Code.  I could not find anything in the HSD.

Description:
Epic: In the telephone encounters the messages are coming up multiple times. If we have to call a patient a few times the same message from the provider is charting itself.  This has been happening since before the upgrade.  Please see screenshots for one example of this.  The notes are being repeated on the chart.  The example attached repeated the same note 4 times.


Asset: ISC85583
User Name: SLHELLEMS
Department: IM LEX SOUTH MAIN [4284001]
Template: AMB NURSE NO PAL [T10055]
Owner: TSG_EPIC_AMBULATORY [12095680]
Pt: See one example attached.
Update Action:
08/17/17 14:49:51 US/Eastern (PLWHITESCARVER):
client called back and let her know that I've put in an SLG.  Talked about other optimization type issues as well with IB
08/17/17 12:56:21 US/Eastern (PLWHITESCARVER):
called client.  she was not in. was told to call back later
08/17/17 12:56:03 US/Eastern (PLWHITESCARVER):
I think this might have to do with an issue that we had a couple of years ago with ADT.  Will be talking to Tara when she returns from a meeting

Sometimes if an IP admission is not closed out it links together notes in the Telephone Encounter.  What will happen is when you create a new telephone note it will list every note that was done previously
Have to send to ADT to have them close the Admit
 
Here is Collen's response:
I think I found the issue here.  That patient has an admission from November of 2009 that was never closed.  It's in Endoscopy RCH, which has a setting in the profile to make encounters within 30 days of the encounter a related encounter.  The admission has never been closed, so it's relating all the encounters since that day.  The documentation section of the telephone encounters navigator only displays telephone notes, so it's only pulling in those from the "related" encounters.
To fix the encounters that were already linked, you'll want to close that admission and use patient station to unlink them.  You can do this by opening patient station, removing the filters on the patient, and clicking the check box next to the encounter to remove the check mark.  This unrelates the encounter.
I don't know if you'll want to change the setting or not, but it's something to consider.
I'm not sure if other patients were affected by this.  We might be able to run a search to find out, but it doesn't seem like it affects patient safety or data accuracy at all, so I don't know how critical it is.

Title:
Hi Marcus, 

I noticed that the version of Dragon on my laptop frequently freezes up, especially if I'm connected outside the hospital. 
This degradation in reliability is pronounced over the last fe
Description:
Other Application / Software:

Hi Marcus,

I noticed that the version of Dragon on my laptop frequently freezes up, especially if I'm connected outside the hospital.
This degradation in reliability is pronounced over the last few months and was rarely a problem last year.

Any thoughts about how to improve reliability?
Thanks

Additional Data:
Affected Service: Dragon Medical One

Impact: 4 - One person
User Name: Moylan
Application: Dragon Medical One
Update Action:
08/23/17 15:50:44 US/Eastern (RBJONES):
Service Request # 102634156

Response from Nuance

Typically when it comes to  delays or freezing issues. We would advise to check on the following
•	Could you check if your antivirus exceptions are in place?
•	Could you check amount of free disk space maintained on your C:\.
•	 At times, these time lags could be due to unwanted data present within the profile , you might have to clean up these un-necessary data from the user profiles  to ensure  steady performance for Dragon and to avoid any delays.
•	Could you check if customer is maintaining a large number of  Auto-texts and/or Custom Commands .Typically, customers who maintain a large number of Auto-texts and/or Custom Commands can experience login delays impacting their DMNE 2.x clients.  The delay duration is longest during the initial login of the user profile.  However, less pronounced delays can also occur with subsequent logins.

Please  check the below i-support solution for more information and verify if your machine also satisfies the requirements

Solution 16879  Microsoft CEIP causes client issues with performance, crashing, and hanging  of
Solution 16721  Maintaining Free Disk Space for Dragon Medical Products
Solution 16396: DMNE automated utility to cleanup non-essential data from user profiles
Solution 15981  Anti-Virus recommendations for Dragon Medical 360 | Network Edition
Solution 16341  Workaround for Login Delays caused by built-in Auto-texts on DMNE 2.1 Clients

In case the same issue persist post applying the above measures, please attach a dragon.log file for further review.

I created Service Request 102634156 with Nuance
08/21/17 09:06:01 US/Eastern (RBJONES):

Title: Yvette called CE saying that she was working an endo case last night that had to be transferred to t
Description:
Yvette called CE saying that she was working an endo case last night that had to be transferred to the OR.  She stated that after she went to the OR, a half hour into the case she received the red screen in epic.  She stated that when she moved to the OR it asked her if she wanted to merge the chart and she said yes.  She had vitals from the Endo portion at that time.  Once she received the Red screen she rebooted the system and she lost her vitals from the Endo portion of the case.  She still had her OR vitals.  She is wondering where her Endo vitals went.  I spoke with Joe Tan and he knows about the ticket coming.

Patient:  Earl Laprade
MRN:  289693

Endo Cart:  RMHANMON36, RMHANMACH36
I have someone getting me the OR Room 7 cart information.
Update Action:
08/25/17 15:35:27 US/Eastern (JRTAN):

Had spoken with client regarding the missing endo data for her vitals that was lost during the hardware issues she experienced, was told that she would have to manually enter data as the data was not recoverable during the outage with the red screen variable she experienced.  She said she didn't have the precise data to enter manually but wrote a quick note that the data / parameters she observed was within normal parameters and noted that patient was stable throughout the endo procedure.  Client wanted to know if the note she wrote was acceptable from a compliance standpoint, told her I'd check with some other folks on the team, sent email to Elaine and Dawn if they agree or know if anything else needs to be added to patient's chart.  - JTan.


From: Tan, Joe R.
Sent: Friday, August 25, 2017 3:31 PM
To: Montgomery, S E. (Elaine); Walker, Dawn R.
Cc: Joseph Tan; Bratton, Ralph E.; TSG_CSE_HomeHealth_OR_RadOnc_Team
Subject: IM398778 - Case with Missing Anesthesia Data


Hi Elaine / Dawn,


This is in regards to the ticket earlier in the week for the missing Anesthesia Data.  Per client for a brief moment in the middle of the case she got the Red Screen of death on her

intraop grid, after talking with her she said she had rebooted the PC several times and the Red Screen went away while patient was in Endo.  They had to transfer patient from Endo to

the OR, but said they lost her Endo Data.  This happened after hours during the weekend.  CE had the ticket and worked on the hardware issues, but she asked if there was anyway to recover her missing data.  CE transferred me the ticket on Monday.  We asked Walker with Excel if devices saved any data, and learned they do not.  Also wasn't sure how long device data is kept in the Epic System before being purged.  We were unable to recover any data and informed the client that she would have to manually enter the data.


She replied that she didn't have the precise information to manually document and did not want to make up any numbers so she wrote a quick note.  Her question was if there was anything else she needed to do and if the quick note was acceptable from a compliance standpoint.  I told her I'd check with some other folks on the team.  Copy of the note entry in the Anesthesia Record below:



Let me know if there is any other additional documentation needed, or if what she documented given the situation is acceptable for this patient's record.


Thanks,

Joe
08/22/17 10:45:34 US/Eastern (JRTAN):
Called client, but was unable to reach this morning, left message that I checked with vendor Excel Medical and also checked with my teammates to discuss issue.  We looked at the chart and the related anesthesia devices and did not find any data that could be imported into the chart for the missing data that the client had reported on.  Earlier ticket was transferred to us from CE to resolve connectivity issues I believe, and she had a question concerning lost data because of this.  We checked and could not find any data to import and after discussing with others on team, concluded that user would have to document data manually.  Called left message and also left my iphone# for client to call back if she had questions.
08/22/17 09:42:14 US/Eastern (JRTAN):
Ticket Update - Reviewing with Elaine and Walker Watson w/ Excel Medical:




From: Tan, Joe R.
Sent: Tuesday, August 22, 2017 9:22 AM
To: Montgomery, S E. (Elaine)
Cc: Joseph Tan; Bratton, Ralph E.; Walker Watson
Subject: Re: Re: Question - Ticket IM398778 - OR Vitals, etc.


If there is no data that can be validated into the chart from the devices then only thing I would think is that the client enter those manually.
From: Montgomery, S E. (Elaine)
Sent: Tuesday, August 22, 2017 8:20:01 AM
To: Tan, Joe R.
Cc: Joseph Tan; Bratton, Ralph E.; Walker Watson
Subject: Re: Re: Question - Ticket IM398778 - OR Vitals, etc.


Joe, she does not have data from 1503 - 1630 in the patient's chart. She will need to enter those times manually.

Joe, I don't know if there is any other way to pull the information, was this a concern with the validation meetings during the build?



Elaine Montgomery, RN BSN CNOR
Application Analyst III
Carilion Clinic Technology Services Group

Epic OpTime/ Epic Anesthesia
Mobile: 540-904-3550
eemontgomery@carilionclinic.org

Our Mission: Improve the health of the communities we serve




From: Tan, Joe R.
Sent: Monday, August 21, 2017 4:56:38 PM
To: Montgomery, S E. (Elaine)
Cc: Joseph Tan; Bratton, Ralph E.; Walker Watson
Subject: Fw: Re: Question - Ticket IM398778 - OR Vitals, etc.



Hey Elaine,


So looking at Walker's response it does not appear any data was retained.  I looked at the patient's Anesthesia Record and looks like case started around 1500 and ended approx 2300 based on the Anesthesia Start/Stop & Data collect event times.


I looked at the interface utilities for the Monitor and Machine listed in the ticket.


Looks like RMHANMON36 stopped collecting data at 4:41pm yesterday and RMHANMACH36 stopped collecting data at 4:37pm yestarday also.  The search criteria I used was for yesterdays date 8/20 from 3pm to 11:30pm and did not have any more data past those times stopped that I could find.




If there was no data to recover to add to the chart, would the recommendation be for her to just manually enter data if she has not already done so?  I just wanted to check if there was anything else that could be done for the client before telling her we are unable to retrieve any data for her.


Thanks,

Joe

Sent: Monday, August 21, 2017 3:52 PM
To: Tan, Joe R.; Montgomery, S E. (Elaine)
Cc: jtan@carilion.com; Bratton, Ralph E.

Database data type change somewhere without the change reflected in the universe.
Prompt changed at the universe level but the change hasn't been picked up by the report.

Title: Security Officers have access to the house census to all patients at NRV as well as  No news patient
Description:
Security Officers have access to the house census to all patients at NRV as well as  No news patients.  As of a few days ago a " No News patient" they would normally show the entire MRN and not the name but now just shows the room /bed , No News icon, and the MRN is missing , used to be ****** plus the MRN number.

Just has been noticed over the last few days but they didn't look at this last week so not sure if something has changed with the upgrade or even a persmission issue now.


Screenshot attached


User: MAVEST
Issue: Not sure if the MRN is missing or changed since upgrade
Update Action:
08/25/17 12:40:06 US/Eastern (WMQUESENBERRY):
Mary is emailing me back and wanted to know if the MRN can be added back to the No news patient identifier.
I sent her the below email

"Hey Mary,

Unfortunately It can not be to my knowledge. I am going to work further with EPIC, but from what I understand, the MRN was never supposed to be shown for folks who did not have no news access. Here’s the reason:

If the MRN shows after the asterisks, the user has a workaround to use that MRN to look up the patient in for instance the patient station activity and it will display who the patient is.. kind of defeating the purpose of blocking the patient’s identifiers if you can look them up by the MRN easily.

Mark says this is not a huge deal, but wanted to know if as a whole we would allow the police dept to see no news patients.



Thanks for your help!"
08/24/17 12:31:45 US/Eastern (WMQUESENBERRY):
Sent an email to Mark letting him know Mary is out of the office until Monday 8/28/17 and that I am trying to work with Beth Snead in Mary's absence. The decision may have to wait until Mary returns.
08/23/17 16:06:37 US/Eastern (WMQUESENBERRY):
Research issue further and constructed an email to the Privacy Officer at Carilion Clinic. (Below)
Hey Mary,

I received a helpdesk ticket from Mark Vest at CNRV. He is a Police Officer with access to EPIC in which the “ADT, Police DEPT” template does not have access to Confidential data (No News Patients). He and about 45-50 other Police Officers use this template in EPIC. The issue he reported is this:

Previous to EPIC 2017 – Users who DID NOT have access to No News Patients (Confidential Data) saw patients on their house Census like this - ****** (MRN# 1234565)

After the EPIC upgrade to version 2017 – Users who DO NOT have access to No New Patients (Confidential Data) see patients like this now -    ******

Therefore users who’s EPIC security were built specifically not to have No News patients used to be able to see the MRN # associated with the No News patient. Now they cannot. Police used to use the MRN # as a “Secret Password” for visitors who may be visiting a No News Patient that may be in CNRV’s Birthplace (a locked down area).

Do you think it is appropriate to give all Police Officers access to No News patients now that they cannot see any identifier at all on patients in activities like patient lists / house censuses? Mark said he would be glad to speak to you if you have additional work flow related questions.

Currently only 3 Police type folks have access to No News patients. They are the “Police Chiefs” and are on a separate Police Chief EPIC template. (Bobby Lugar, Ron Donelson, Patricia Hepburn)


Please feel free to reach out to me if you’d rather chat on the phone or in person about this.


Thanks!
08/22/17 11:26:49 US/Eastern (WMQUESENBERRY):
Called and spoke with Mark Vest.
He was very pleasant and just explained that they used to use the "last four" of the MRN to determine a "Passcode" for visitors for no news patients in placed such as the birthplace and St. Albans.

I am going to reach out to Mary potter to let her know what changed with the upgrade and whether or not it is appropriate for Police officers to have access to No news patients in general now that the system changed slightly on how it displays no news.
08/21/17 17:19:26 US/Eastern (WMQUESENBERRY):
Bret and I researched this issue.
There was a nova note about the EPIC 2017 upgrade in which No News security is actually RESPECTING the security points now.
ADT, Police DEPT were on purpose not given "No News" access. But they had a work around all along.
Mark is complaining they can no longer use the workaround.
I need to follow up with the Police Cheif and with Mary Potter to determine if this access is appropriate for all Police Officers.

I tried to call Mark to let him know but he had already left for the day.

I will call him in the morning.
08/21/17 16:55:56 US/Eastern (xMatters):
[xMatters] - Acknowledged by WMQUESENBERRY (Work Email)
08/21/17 16:50:12 US/Eastern (xMatters):
[xMatters] - Notification delivered successfully to WMQUESENBERRY | Work Email

Title: Since the EPIC upgrade when patients are arrived for their Nuc Stress and also have an Echo scheduled the same day both are showing "complete" under the patient's "appt"desk under MSPQ. With that sai
Description:
Epic: Since the EPIC upgrade when patients are arrived for their Nuc Stress and also have an Echo scheduled the same day both are showing "complete" under the patient's "appt" desk under MSPQ. With that said when we print the patient's AVS their echo appt is not showing. This is causing an issue and a potential for a patient to miss their next appt for the same day in cardiology. Under the Card/Vasc tab it shows under Cardio Status as "complete" when it has not even be done. I believe this is happening when the patient is checked in at the front desk for one of their appt's and is caught it to 'arrive" them for both. In the past, all future appts showed and printed on the patient's AVS but, now they are not. Please look into this and correct as soon as you can. This is a big issue. Thank you. Brenda

User Name: BGMCCULLOUGH
Department: CARDIOLOGY RKE TESTS
Template: CARDIANT AMB CV TECHNOLOGIST
Update Action:
08/25/17 13:11:07 US/Eastern (CAWARNOCK):
I spoke with Brenda.  She confirmed that both appts are checked in at the same time.  That way the patient does not have to go back the the check in desk for the 2nd appt.  They go right to the sub waiting room for the Echo.  I sent an email to Teresa Maybaum asking if there is a way for appts that are in an "arrived" status to still show up on the AVS.  Waiting to hear from  her.
08/25/17 12:09:01 US/Eastern (CAWARNOCK):
Researched this more today.  We believe it is work flow.  Both appts are being checked in at the same time.  Now with the new AVS set up, it does not show appts that are in an "arrived" status.  I have called Brenda to verify this if she knows and I sent an email to her asking for pt examples.  I also sent an email to Tina Cook asking about the check in work flow.  Waiting on that reply.
08/24/17 15:27:42 US/Eastern (CAWARNOCK):
I have reviewed some of this in SUP.  I believe the issue is those type of appts are being made as a "sequential" appts.  I have asked Brenda for some examples to verify my finding.  Waiting to hear from her.
08/24/17 13:35:19 US/Eastern (CAWARNOCK):
I spoke with Brenda today.  Below is the work flow example:

I have 2 appts today in CARDIOLOGY RKE TESTS.  One at 10am and another at 3pm.  I arrive for my 10am appt, check in, answer the MSPQ.  I check out.  AVS prints with upcoming appts.  The 3pm appt is not showing on the AVS.  (which it should since it's a future appt).

The Techs use the AVS to help prep for the 2nd appt for that patient.

Title: There are 3 RN's whose names are showing up in the process user space where we usually only see the analysts names.  This has been seen since the upgrade.  The RN's don't have anything to do with def
Description:
Epic:
There are 3 RN's whose names are showing up in the process user space where we usually only see the analysts names.  This has been seen since the upgrade.  The RN's don't have anything to do with deficiencies adding/completing so their names shouldn't show up in the process user space.  We usually only see them in the audit trail.  My supervisor Kari said we needed to put in a ticket for this.

The RN names are Shelly Freeman, Cindy Jamison and Geneva Lawrence
3 chart examples:
Timothy Miles 088286 8/21/17
Grayson Rech 651744 8/19/17
Caitlyn Simms 8667656 8/20/17

Epic ID: JCPHOENIX
Login dept: HIM RMH [1000072]
Template: HIM ANALYST [HIMANROI]

Patient First Name: Timothy
Patient Last Name: Miles
Patient MRN: 088286
Update Action:
08/24/17 14:36:35 US/Eastern (KESTEAHLY):
We never heard back from ASAP support.  We talked with Andrea Epic TS for ADT and Adam.  They could not figure this out either.  Opened SLG 3381959 for both ADT and HIM at Epic to research further.

Also client emailed me and I updated her on what we have found and that Epic is looking at this.
08/23/17 17:16:22 US/Eastern (KESTEAHLY):
WOrked with Joyce on this.   We are now waiting on Clindoc to get back with us on what auto undo discharge is so we can try and figure out how these nurses names got in here.  We were unable to recreate but all the examples had this auto undo discharge associated with them.   Waiting on reply from Todd to further research.
08/23/17 16:16:27 US/Eastern (JWBOOKER):
Worked with Karen regarding the issue.  Created test patients in test environment to recreate the situation.  In Production found that the patients are showing in event management as an auto undo discharge event by the nurse.  This action appears to be making the RN as the process user.  I called Todd Null (on call for ASAP) and he is validating this workflow.
08/23/17 15:01:11 US/Eastern (MTNULL):
Confirmed that the Encounter Status "Undone to Confirmed Admission" with a reason of "(ED auto undo)" occurrs in the ED when a patient is discharged and the ED RN clicks the "Undo ED Discharge/Dismiss" button in the menu.  This feature has been available for a number of years and the IP team did not alter any configuration related to it during the 2017 upgrade.  We tested this feature in POC, SUP and RLB with the same results visible in the Patient Events Activity and in Event Management.  Is it possible that a change in Identity configuration changed to cause these events to create a deficiency?

The Manager is having her staff call the sites in question and ask them to attempt to send a fax to her site and then send the fax back, if received, to test.  The Manager will email with an update.

08/27/17 12:23:25 US/Eastern (SSALIFU):
I called up customer to assist her and she was so abusive:
1. As soon as she picked up the phone she said she could not hear me so I needed to give the phone to an American so she could talk to that person - I thought my line was bad, so I told her to give me a moment to call her back.

2. I called her back, she picked up then hanged up on me

3. I called her back again and asked her if she could explain the problem further to me so I could see how best I could help her then she started being rude and shouting that if someone said they could not login it means they could not login and that what more did I need to hear.

4. She added that I should either change her username or password for her to login...then abusively that "that is all I need from you" "you claim you offer professional service, so where is the professional service..."

5. I tried to calm her down, and asked her to give me a while to change her password for her

6. While I was working through the system she kept abusing me in the background ... I did not interrupt her

7. While I was just about to change the password, she said this was taking too long then hanged up on me again

8. I did not call her back again, because I knew she was agitated about something, I did not want to engage her any further.

9. Hopefully when she is calm enough we can talk through this one more time.

Title: Unable to edit charts done by Residents. Goes into the chart and there should be an edit button.
Description:

Update Action:
08/28/17 07:41:10 US/Eastern (PLWHITESCARVER):
I think I know how you can edit these.  From your Cosign Charts folder, click on the message and then the button you want to click is Encounter.  There is no Edit button.  If it prompts you for Addendum then click Create Addendum.  Then just go to the Notes section and click the Addend button under the Resident's name.
See if that might fix the issue you were having and let me know if it's resolved.  Give me a call if you're still not able to edit.

Title: Provider is having issues with the R4 application and her dual monitors.
Description:
Provider is having issues with the R4 application and her dual monitors.

When viewing images from R4, they are opening on the wrong screen and she has to move it to the second screen every time she wants to view an image.

I had her show me the process:

Logs into R4
Pulls up patient
Clicks to view images

The image pops up above the application and she has to move it to the 2nd screen every time.

Windows does not appear to remember the position of the image window and opens it over the application. I have checked her monitor settings are they are configured correctly, this application seems to be the only one having this issue.

She states that none of the other providers have this issue.

I have agreed to research the issue and will follow up with the provider via email to see if we can find any solutions.

Title: Starting on August 4, 2017 system generated adjustment postings are entering Adjustment Review Workqueue - HO INSURANCE ADJUSTMENTS TIER 1 3177.  My manager Elaine Gravely has asked me to put in a ti
Description:
Starting on August 4, 2017 system generated adjustment postings are entering Adjustment Review Workqueue - HO INSURANCE ADJUSTMENTS TIER 1 3177.  My manager Elaine Gravely has asked me to put in a ticket because we have a question.  We do not know why these are going into this WQ.  We need to understand why these are entering this WQ for her to post the adjustment.  Every claim that is at claim acceptance is going into this WQ.  There are over 200 and each day more are being added.  She and myself do not know why these are going to this WQ.    I am not referring to the post adjustments that I manually request that are then sent to this WQ for her to review and accept.  Something happened in EPIC on 8/4/17 that caused this and would like clarification.

Additional Data:

Impact: 3 - Entire unit / department
User Name: ljvazquez
Department: cc hh ho scheduling
Patient First Name:
Patient Middle Name:
Patient Last Name:
Patient MRN:
Patient Order Number:
Patient Account Number:
Patient CSN:
Patient DOB:
Invoice Number:
Update Action:
08/28/17 12:28:28 US/Eastern (SMDAVIS):
**The functionality for posting adjustments at claims acceptance, rather than at remittance posting was put into PRD on 8.10.17, so I'm not aware of any reason why these adjustments started qualifying for BWQ 3177 on 8.4.17.  I reviewed my incident spreadsheet & do not see any changes to the RMC immediately prior to that date.

The logic for BWQ 3177 - HO INSURANCE ADJUSTMENTS TIER 1 includes:
- Hospice account class
- Adjustments not approved by Level 1
- Adjustments made on Insurance buckets
- Adjustments not posted by user HB, BACKGROUND
- Adjustments between -$100.00 - $100.00

I have reviewed a couple of the charge sessions in BWQ 3177,  paying closer attention to the Adjustment Source.

1. Session 187888587 - Kafley, Bachi
HAR62310000306
-$403.26
 adj source = Post Adjustment - Account Maintenance

2. Session 187958255 - Via, William
HAR7309072
$2527.04
adj source = Adjustment Posting

Are you stating that one of these types of adjustments do not need to be reviewed?
